title: Indemnification of officers, employees, and agents
context: [ยง414D-165] Indemnification of officers, employees, and agents. (a) An officer of the corporation who is not a director, unless limited by a corporation&rsquo;s articles of incorporation, is entitled to mandatory indemnification under section 414D-161, and is entitled to apply for court-ordered indemnification under section 414D-163 in each case, to the same extent as a director. (b) The corporation, unless limited by a corporation&rsquo;s articles of incorporation, may indemnify and advance expenses under this part to an officer, employee, or agent of the corporation who is not a director to the same extent as to a director. &copy; A corporation may also, unless limited by a corporation&rsquo;s articles of incorporation, indemnify and advance expenses to an officer, employee, or agent who is not a director to the extent, consistent with public policy, that may be provided by its articles of incorporation, bylaws, general or specific action of its board of directors, or contract. [L 2001, c 105, pt of ยง1]
